findings.title: Insecure pseudo–random number generation
findings.explanation: The contract uses keccak256(blockhash(blockNumber), msg.sender) and block.number–based logic for randomness. Miners can influence blockhash or postpone including the transaction to bias the outcome.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a secure external randomness source (e.g., Chainlink VRF) or a commit–reveal scheme rather than on–chain block data.

findings.title: External call before state update in donateToWhale
findings.explanation: The function performs whale.call.value(amount)(…) before updating totalDonated. A malicious whale contract could reenter and manipulate contract state before the donation amount is recorded.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the checks–effects–interactions pattern: update totalDonated before making the external call or use a reentrancy guard.

findings.title: Unchecked low–level call return value
findings.explanation: The contract uses whale.call.value(amount)(…) but does not check the returned boolean. If the call fails, the failure is silent, potentially leading to a loss of user funds or inconsistent state.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the return value of the low–level call and revert on failure, e.g., `require(whale.call.value(amount)(…));`.

unmatched_predictions.title: External call before state update in donateToWhale
